dct_title_s: Mouth of South Black River, Michigan
dct_alternative_sm: Mouth of South Black River, Michigan from survey made in August 1856 by assistant John R. Mayer, under the direction of Brevet Lieut. Col. J.D. Graham, Major, U.S. Top. Engineers. Superintending Engineer of Lake Michigan Works.
dct_description_sm: "Soundings are in feet and tenths of a foot."
"The figures on land express the elevations above the lake surface in feet and decimals. The horizontal curves or contour lines are drawn at intervals of 5 feet of perpendicular elevation."
"Accompanying Lt. Colonel Graham's annual report (no. 200) to the Chief Top. Engineer, dated Chicago September 30th 1857."
dct_creator_sm: United States. Army. Corps of Topographical Engineers
dcat_keyword_sm: Real property Michigan New Rochester Maps.
dct_rights_sm: This map is in the public domain.
dct_rightsHolder_sm: Please attribute access and use of this digitized map to the Stephen S. Clark Library, University of Michigan Library. https://www.lib.umich.edu/about-us/policies/copyright-policy
